ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: General functions for performing extreme value analysis.  In particular, allows for inclusion of covariates into the parameters of the extreme-value distributions, as well as estimation through MLE, L-moments, generalized (penalized) MLE (GMLE), as well as Bayes.  Inference methods include parametric normal approximation, profile-likelihood, Bayes, and bootstrapping.  Some bivariate functionality and dependence checking (e.g., auto-tail dependence function plot, extremal index estimation) is also included.  For a tutorial, see Gilleland and Katz (2016) <doi: 10.18637/jss.v072.i08> and for bootstrapping, please see Gilleland (2020) <doi: 10.1175/JTECH-D-20-0070.1>.

General functions for performing extreme value analysis.  In particular, allows for inclusion of covariates into the parameters of the extreme-value distributions, as well as estimation through MLE, L-moments, generalized (penalized) MLE (GMLE), as well as Bayes.  Inference methods include parametric normal approximation, profile-likelihood, Bayes, and bootstrapping.  Some bivariate functionality and dependence checking (e.g., auto-tail dependence function plot, extremal index estimation) is also included.  For a tutorial, see Gilleland and Katz (2016) <doi: 10.18637/jss.v072.i08> and for bootstrapping, please see Gilleland (2020) <doi: 10.1175/JTECH-D-20-0070.1>.

name: r-extremes
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.2-1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-extremes
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/extRemes_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/extRemes/extRemes_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 268f5d2b607437c49fd63f17978763bea6bfbc85c062ca3975e5550ce162e969

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-lmoments
    - r-distillery >=1.0_4
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-lmoments
    - r-distillery >=1.0_4

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('extRemes')"  # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('extRemes')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=extRemes
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: 'General functions for performing extreme value analysis.  In particular, allows for
    inclusion of covariates into the parameters of the extreme-value distributions,
    as well as estimation through MLE, L-moments, generalized (penalized) MLE (GMLE),
    as well as Bayes.  Inference methods include parametric normal approximation, profile-likelihood,
    Bayes, and bootstrapping.  Some bivariate functionality and dependence checking
    (e.g., auto-tail dependence function plot, extremal index estimation) is also included.  For
    a tutorial, see Gilleland and Katz (2016) <doi: 10.18637/jss.v072.i08> and for bootstrapping,
    please see Gilleland (2020) <doi: 10.1175/JTECH-D-20-0070.1>.'
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
